snippet: Experts are working to reduce the dangers of grade-level rail crossings like the one in Valhalla, N.Y., that was the scene of a deadly accident on Tuesday. But human behavior can defeat even the safest system, researchers say.
abstract: Engineers worldwide are trying to improve safety of grade-level crossings like one involved in fatal crash between Metro-North train and vehicle near Valhalla, NY; experts say, however, that human error and physics can undermine even best safety systems.
lead_paragraph: Experts are working to reduce the dangers of grade-level rail crossings like the one in Valhalla, N.Y., that was the scene of a deadly accident on Tuesday. But human behavior can defeat even the safest system, researchers say.

headline.main: Human Behavior and Physics Hamper Rail Safety Systems
headline.print_headline: Human Behavior and Physics Hamper Rail Safety Systems
